Test Name: Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) Children's Oncology Group Enrollment FISH Test
Specimen Type: Peripheral blood or bone marrow aspirate
Purpose: To detect AML-associated genetic abnormalities via fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) for eligibility and enrollment in Children's Oncology Group studies.
Equipment: Automated FISH slide processor; fluorescence microscope with appropriate filters; thermocycler for slide denaturation; incubators set at 37 °C and 75 °C; cytocentrifuge
